• Locals have expressed concerns about excessive energy usage, increased utility rates, noise pollution

items.title: Scientists just found a molecule that could stop Parkinson’s in its tracks
bullets: • Researchers have designed a peptide that prevents the deadly misfolding of alpha-synuclein, the protein behind Parkinson’s and some dementias

• The work demonstrates the power of rational drug design in tackling brain diseases that have long lacked effective treatments

items.title: Glacier melt will lead to ice-free peaks in California for first time in human history
bullets: • California's Sierra Nevada glaciers are projected to melt away completely by the beginning of the next century
• The mountain range’s glaciers are older than previously known, with some as old as the last ice age
• A future glacier-free Sierra Nevada is unprecedented in human history since known peopling of the Americas, researchers say

items.title: Physicists just built a quantum lie detector. It works

• Results show quantum computers are not just bigger, but more authentically quantum

items.title: AI models can acquire backdoors from surprisingly few malicious documents
bullets: • Researchers say large language models like ChatGPT, Gemini, and Claude can develop backdoor vulnerabilities from as few as 250 corrupted documents inserted into training data
• The research involved training AI language models ranging from 600 million to 13 billion parameters on datasets scaled appropriately for their size
• Researchers: Poisoning attacks require a near-constant number of documents regardless of model size

items.title: Senate Nixes Management Plans to Open Access for Fossil Fuels
bullets: • The Senate approved three resolutions this week that wipe out resource management plans enacted during the Biden administration in Alaska, Montana and North Dakota
• The resolutions came under the Congressional Review Act, which empowers Congress to nullify executive branch rules
• The Biden-era plans had ended coal leasing in the prolific Powder River Basin and limited access to oil and gas development

• The company had said last month that it was going to set up this pilot program for “a subset of creators” and “channels terminated for policies that have been deprecated”

items.title: Belkin’s new power bank gives your smartphone a camera grip for $80
bullets: • Belkin’s Stage PowerGrip turns your smartphone into a DSLR-style camera and keeps it charged with a 9,300mAh battery
• It also has its own shutter button, positioned on the top edge of the grip so it sits beneath your finger, that snaps images using a Bluetooth connection to your phone
• Apple sells a similar accessory through its website called the ShiftCam SnapGrip Pro for $90

items.title: HBO’s next Game of Thrones spinoff premieres in January
bullets: • HBO announced today that A Knight of Seven Kingdoms’ six-episode-long first season will begin airing on January 18th, 2026
• Based on Martin’s Tales of Dunk and Egg novellas, the series chronicles the adventures of Ser Duncan the Tall (Peter Claffey) and prince Aegon Targaryen

items.title: Weekend projections: One Battle After Another and Gabby’s Dollhouse hoping for good word-of-mouth after middling debuts
bullets: • One Battle After Another will have the distinction of giving Paul Thomas Anderson his best weekend ever, besting the $4.9 million earned by There Will Be Blood during its run back in January 2008
• The new film will need exceptional legs to justify its higher production budget ($140 million vs
• $25 million for There Will be Blood), and marketing costs
• Gabby’s Dollhouse: The Movie will likewise need great word-of-mouth to become a hit

items.title: Weekend predictions: One Battle After Another will win the weekend
bullets: • One Battle After Another will mark the start of awards season with an opening that looks set to exceed $20 million
• That will ensure not only a best weekend for Anderson, but also his first chart-topper
• The closest he's come is There Will Be Blood, which picked up $4.87 million on its fifth weekend in release, back in January 2008
